title: Solving One-Step and Two-Step Equations

vocab.definition: A mathematical statement that two expressions are equal
The value that makes an equation true
To get a variable by itself on one side of an equation
To keep an equation equal by doing the same thing to both sides

teachingNotes: Emphasize that whatever you do to one side, you must do to the other. Start with one-step equations before moving to two-step.

sample.question: What is a mathematical statement that two expressions are equal?

truefalse.question: To solve x + 5 = 12, you subtract 5 from both sides.

multiplechoice.question: What is the solution to x - 3 = 7?

fillintheblank.question: To get a variable by itself on one side is to ________ it.

wordProblems.question: Maria has some stickers. After giving away 8 stickers, she has 15 left. How many stickers did she start with?
